p.span: Clarksburg is a small Town of 1670 Residents nestled on the Vermont Boarder to the North, comprising of 12 sq. miles. Approximately 53% of the land mass of the Town of Clarksburg is owned by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Many scenic vistas and rugged terrain surrounds the valley Community, with fertile plateaus divided by the North Branch of the North Branch of the Hoosac River.

div.p:
Clarksburg was first settled in 1769 by Captain Matthew Ketchum, Nicholas Clark and others.
